Posts.Content:
I used the Chantix when I started my chemo. It worked where nothing else did. I was on my 4th week when I had trouble with nausea, so I cut down to 1 per day then eventually 1 every other day and finally at 6 weeks stopped. I am 8 months smoke free now and feeling great about
 it. Good luck, if it can help a smoker of 40 years it can help you!
Posts.Title: Neuropathy

Posts.Content:
Hi~
I just finished 6 months of chemo. The first course was Adrimiacin+cytoxin and the second course Taxol. I had no trouble with the first course [be sure to take your Emend and they gave me Aloxi before my treatment]. The Taxol gave me a lot of muscle aches that have lingered, but everything is doable. Good luck and hang in there!!
Karon from Illinois
Posts.Title: Red Devil Chemo

Posts.Content: Hang in there Laurie. I was diagnosed this last April. In May had a mastectomy and reconstruction done. Not bad at all. I had wonderful drs and they helped me thru all of it. I was also on HRT and I agree--tell everyone you know STAY OFF IT!!!!!!! I was estrogen+ [985] and progesterone+ [97%]. Sentinal nodes clear. I'm now on my second course of chemo [AC dense dose first and now Taxol] I have good days and bad days with that, but it's doable. Just remember-you are a survivor!
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed....

Posts.Content:
Hi~
I'm Karon from Robinson IL. I was diagnosed with ILC in my right breast in April 2007. Had masectomy and reconstruction[ Latissumus flap + silicone implant] in May 2007. 2cm tumor, nodes clear ER/PR+ HER-, Stage 1. Started DD A/C in June, then Taxol. Finished chemo in December 2007. Now on Aromasin for 5 years. Feeling good!
